subs.text: July 27
@amberlough AFAIK, while the card will do for a lot of things, it’s not official ID (like for crossing borders). Only country of citizenship can issue official ID.
subs.rawText: @amberlough AFAIK, while the card will do for a lot of things, it’s not official ID (like for crossing borders). Only country of citizenship can issue official ID.

subs.text: @amberlough Border guards don’t issue passports, they just look at them! 😛
subs.rawText: @amberlough Border guards don’t issue passports, they just look at them! 😛

subs.text: @HejM0 Our electricity bills are currently negotiated monthly so we get those increases in real time 😀 (market is so jumpy it makes no sense to lock in future prices, say our consultants)
subs.rawText: @HejM0 Our electricity bills are currently negotiated monthly so we get those increases in real time 😀 (market is so jumpy it makes no sense to lock in future prices, say our consultants)

subs.text: @tessaapproves @bzbear2 @HamburgSent German waitstaff are likely covered by the collective bargaining agreement between the local DEHOGA and the union NGG. US waitstaff are likely not covered by such an agreement.
subs.rawText: @tessaapproves @bzbear2 @HamburgSent German waitstaff are likely covered by the collective bargaining agreement between the local DEHOGA and the union NGG. US waitstaff are likely not covered by such an agreement.

subs.text: @faerirose @MCinHD @Heather_inDE We‘re still in the US, but HAM-CDG-MSP with AF/DL went alright for us (separate flights 1 wk apart) with checkin night before, allowing 2+ hours for security (actual time 1 hr), and no checked luggage. One leg canceled on 48 hr notice but automatically rebooked.
subs.rawText: @faerirose @MCinHD @Heather_inDE We‘re still in the US, but HAM-CDG-MSP with AF/DL went alright for us (separate flights 1 wk apart) with checkin night before, allowing 2+ hours for security (actual time 1 hr), and no checked luggage. One leg canceled on 48 hr notice but automatically rebooked.

subs.text: @jenrazzle @c0urtneyH I’ve had Global Entry for a couple years and it is 100% worth it. I had to wait a few months to get approved and be told to make an appointment, and that was in good times.
subs.rawText: @jenrazzle @c0urtneyH I’ve had Global Entry for a couple years and it is 100% worth it. I had to wait a few months to get approved and be told to make an appointment, and that was in good times.

subs.text: @jenrazzle @c0urtneyH Although it didn’t really pay off until my wife had it too. I’d get done with the kiosk in 2 minutes and wait for her 45 minutes to get through the line. And it is a bit creepy to not show your passport and enter on facial recognition alone.
subs.rawText: @jenrazzle @c0urtneyH Although it didn’t really pay off until my wife had it too. I’d get done with the kiosk in 2 minutes and wait for her 45 minutes to get through the line. And it is a bit creepy to not show your passport and enter on facial recognition alone.

subs.text: I flew to MSP early, wife is joining me Friday on our original flight. Her first leg HAM-AMS just canceled, she now flies through CDG. Can’t pick seats, but at least she has one. #AirTravelMeltdown
subs.rawText: I flew to MSP early, wife is joining me Friday on our original flight. Her first leg HAM-AMS just canceled, she now flies through CDG. Can’t pick seats, but at least she has one. #AirTravelMeltdown

subs.text: July 5
My normal travel schedule to the US qualifies for Silver status on Delta, but I’ve gotten so many apology miles the past year I’ll hit Platinum with my next trip. #AirTravelMeltdown
subs.rawText: My normal travel schedule to the US qualifies for Silver status on Delta, but I’ve gotten so many apology miles the past year I’ll hit Platinum with my next trip. #AirTravelMeltdown

subs.text: July 4
The good news: my brother is out of the hospital and I’m home with my mother. The bad news: today it will be 95°F (35°C) with humidity to match (95%). [link]
subs.rawText: The good news: my brother is out of the hospital and I’m home with my mother. The bad news: today it will be 95°F (35°C) with humidity to match (95%). https://t.co/HbvG5CjcU4

subs.text: Good morning from Gorecki Guest House at St. Cloud Hospital. My brother is next door for a hopefully routine procedure. My mom is with him 120 miles from home, where she left her car because she can’t drive. I’m now here, also without a car but I can drive. We’ll work this out. [link]
subs.rawText: Good morning from Gorecki Guest House at St. Cloud Hospital. My brother is next door for a hopefully routine procedure. My mom is with him 120 miles from home, where she left her car because she can’t drive. I’m now here, also without a car but I can drive. We’ll work this out. https://t.co/XZb2tIX0aq

subs.text: @NuwOne Because of the current situation at airports. We saw a YouTube video from a woman saying she can travel for a month out of a carry-on and a small backpack. I thought I’d try it, and my wife will too when she joins me next week.
subs.rawText: @NuwOne Because of the current situation at airports. We saw a YouTube video from a woman saying she can travel for a month out of a carry-on and a small backpack. I thought I’d try it, and my wife will too when she joins me next week.

subs.text: @NuwOne I’m usually a chicken guy. And I’ve never been a wine for breakfast guy!
subs.rawText: @NuwOne I’m usually a chicken guy. And I’ve never been a wine for breakfast guy!

subs.text: @NuwOne Ha! Would have loved a French breakfast at CDG, but too crowded so I had to wait for “chicken or pasta” on the plane. Funniest thing was the lady on the first leg complaining that Air France did not offer wine at 6:30am!
subs.rawText: @NuwOne Ha! Would have loved a French breakfast at CDG, but too crowded so I had to wait for “chicken or pasta” on the plane. Funniest thing was the lady on the first leg complaining that Air France did not offer wine at 6:30am!

subs.text: CDG was chaotic (strikes, but only a bit more chaos than usual for CDG). Passport control took 35 minutes), takeoff was an hour late. Woke up from my nap to see we’re approaching Greenland. [link]
subs.rawText: CDG was chaotic (strikes, but only a bit more chaos than usual for CDG). Passport control took 35 minutes), takeoff was an hour late. Woke up from my nap to see we’re approaching Greenland. https://t.co/jPhdO5cp2V

subs.text: @deutschbitte My home LK Harburg offers 4th boosters to all adults 6 months after the 3rd. There are 4 stations in Winsen, Fleestedt, Neu Wulmstorf and Buchholz. We don’t have 4th boosters yet, this is the info from the LK. [link]

subs.text: @bzbear2 Security is short-staffed and school vacation is starting. Wait times have been up to 3 hours the past few days.

subs.text: @deutschbitte That I’m not sure of. We live across the border in Lower Saxony, there the second booster is available to all.
